intro: Monochaetum rivulare f. glandulosum, commonly known as the glandular monochaetum, is a rare and unique plant species native to specific regions of Australia. It belongs to the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its distinctive glandular structures on its foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in rocky or sandy soils. Its leaves are narrow and often have a rough texture due to the presence of glandular hairs. This subspecies is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and unique morphological features.
